review: As far as Chilis goes this is one if my favorites.   I have lunch here all the time.  The service and food is always great.   Judging by reviews I wonder if people come at night when Doral dies anyway.    If you think this place is bad you need to see a truly horrible Chilis, go to the Grove.  Food trucks are better than that one.

2x1 Drinks Chips and Salsa Big Mouth Bites Ya, no need to look at the menu. Chow down on these items and you're good to go.  Parking may be a challenge especially during happy hour. There's a log right next to it that works, otherwise park on the far end by where Hooters and Walmart is located.
Just like any other Chili's ive been to. I don't go when it's busy so I never have a problem with service. However I know this location can get very crowded on weekends and Friday nights.

2 4 1, drinks. What can I say, but I will stop coming to this place. The food is too greasy and does not taste well. Last 2 times I have been here, I have left with a stomach ach. The 2 41 are really not all that special. Have you seen the little mugs they come in? well thats why they 241. Our waiter took forever to serve us, to clean our table, to offer us drinks. I would not waste my money here again.

This place is ok but the parking area and the spots are tiny.  to fit a midsize car you need two spaces or the person to your right and left will ding your car?!? =___= i felt like a b#*$# for taking two spot but dude my car is brand new and a lease so it wasnt worth the dings and scratches to be obtained.   Anyways, the drinks here are no joke.  They are pretty strong.  I love the margaritas here and the food here is alright.  Good place to come for happy hour.  Not so much to say for my car.

Best time to go is either as soon as it opens, during the week days around lunch time, or not on the weekends at all! This place gets packed and for good reason. Everybody knows about the 2 for 1 drinks and their free salsa chips (depending on if your waitress is a bitch or not). Usually when they serve you, for example, Cranberry and Vodka....they'd usually give you a ridiculously gratuitous amount of Vodka....I'm talking 'the bartender isn't looking as the vodka pours into your cup' amount of Vodka. Obviously that's a good thing!  I would've given it 5 stars, but it's always crowded and people know this....yet they keep going to these crowded places. Great place and probably one of the highest grossing Chili's restaurants in the country.

WHAT IN THE WORLD IS WRONG WITH THE FOOD/MANAGEMENT HERE??!! Even though I'm in this area often, this is my first time at this Chili's and I will never go again.  My hubby and I stopped in on a Saturday late afternoon for lunch. We are really Chili's lovers and frequent other locations all over Dade/Broward (and the US). The place was packed so we thought we were going to have our "regular" tasty meals. NOT! All we ordered was a bacon cheeseburger and the Triple Dipper appetizer, neither one of us came close to finishing our meal, something just wasn't right and I didn't figure it out until some friends told me the following Monday that some restaurants of this stature in Miami mass produce their food on the weekend. A light bulb came on then because this was the WORSE Chili's location EVER. (same exact experience here as at the TGI Fridays at Dolphin mall, a complete and utter disaster). I guess they stay packed because of so many immigrants/international visitors to the malls in this area? Even the Hialeah Chili's was 10X better than this location.  We would've been better off stopping at McDonald's for a Big Mac, at least it would've been semi-fresh. If this place makes there most popular dishes and keeps them under a warmer (as it seems) the manager needs to be fired. I'd rather wait longer for a meal than get it in 5 minutes because you made it hours ago. Specifics below: Chips & Salsa: *sigh* the chips were not fresh, they were as stale as a workday is long. Bacon Cheeseburger: My husband is not a foodie, expert, or good on descriptions, all he knows is his burger (for the first time at any Chili's location) sucked and just didn't seem right to him, he left half of it on the plate and didn't even finish the fries. He lost his appetite.   Triple Dipper: My southwestern eggrolls were old and a bit withered, it was about 2-3PM and it looked like they'd been kept under a warmer since 11am (or yesterday?). My boneless honey chipotle chicken wings were SUPER CRUSTY as if they'd been fried a LONG TIME AGO and again kept in a warmer until I ordered them, then drizzled with sauce. No, you heard me right, DRIZZLED, not dipped, tossed or covered. That's how I could tell they were so old, they were naked.  They were like plain, crusty pieces of chicken. Some so hard, you could barely bite down on them. My burger bites? Oooohhh, do I even have to go there? The burgers were OLD! The bun was stuck to the cheese, and not because it was melted, but because it appeared they had been again kept under a warmer so long the cheese was welded to the bread, the sauce that comes on the little burgers was dried out, and the meat was dry. This place is a disgrace to Chili's everywhere.
Male bathroom needs dividers between the urinal stalls, if u wear slippers watch out for the guy next to u as his stall is lower and you will get tinkled upon. Food is ok.

Have ordered pick up from here several times and their curb side service is awesome. On several occasions I have been with my kids and its difficult to get down with both of them (2and 5), ill call them once I'm outside and they are ready, fast and pleasant to deal with. Today I ordered for pick up, although I did not use their curb side, when I got down everything was just coming out, ready as ordered and as usual fast and pleasant to deal with. Could never go wrong with the Southwestern egg rolls so yummy. First time ordering the crispy boneless buffalo chicken and they  are truly crispy and tasty. Munched on my husbands order of chicken quesadillas and was not very pleased, seemed like we ordered an onion quesadilla with chicken. There was too much onion for my taste.

I got my Baby fat , baby fat , baby fat! and I loved it! I ordered the appetizer taster. It included 2 sliders, 2 southwest egg rolls and 5 boneless wings. the food was what I wanted comfort. I did witness a hostess to tell some guests that they had to get up and go back to the front to wait to be seated. itt was sight! Also, there was a lady in the kitchen with the most foul mouth! I could hear her cussing up a storm. Good thing there were no kids around.

What is happening to the quality of food at Chili's???? 5 years ago they were great! Now the chicken in the fajitas is rubbery and the crispers are a step above McDonalds Mcnuggets that I could get for a dollar on Mondays!! Their saving grace are the desserts! Figure it out Chili's and bring back the good food you used to have or Flanigan's is gonna kick your ass!

Rating mostly for the service we received.  Waitress could have been better. We had asked for a double scoop of ice cream with our Molten cake and she forgot it, by the time she brought it we no longer needed it. She was also nowhere to be found (most of the night) when we needed a refills. As for the food it's what you expect from Chili's they never seem to disappoint.
Beer is watered down. Doesn't matter which you pick. Every time friends and I order pints or pitchers for 2for1 it's the same issue. It's obvious it's on purpose

I really like this Chilis mainly because of the service. The food is the same as any other chili's. I can do away with the sticky tables and the sticky menu's but... what do you expect? We come because we always get coupons for free app & you can't beat their 2-4-1. The skillet queso is always great, so are the free chips and salsa by the bar, the Texas cheese fries are always extra greasy. You can get away with the obviousness of the grease by asking for the fries to be extra crispy. We also LOVE the baked potato soup. Best Baked Potato soup I have tried.

Service was horrible.  The waiter wasn't rude, but he was never around and he kept forgetting things.  The hostess walked us to the table, dropped menus and walked off.  Typical chili food, but served with unusually bad service.

The great american place to eat....if you do not mind the wait. I live nearby and visited frequently shortly after they opened a few years ago. Great food especially their beef fajitas which was my typical order. Truly inexpensive prices.  Always had great service. Casual relaxed atmosphere. Very, very busy which means very loud especially if you have someone's poorly raised kids next to you... Now they are just too popular and too busy to visit compared to other places within a 1-2 minute drive. My favorite dish was the fajitas and there is another place nearby which offers them just as nice but larger portion and increased price as well which keeps the crowd down.  Recommend just know you will wait to be seated for a long time which appears even longer when you are hungry.
It's a Chilis. What can I say? If you've even been to a chilies before then you've been to this one. They are all the same. Avoid this place on the weekends, it gets packed.
We just tried to sit a party of 5, and they wanted us to wait 30 minutes, and the place is empty! WTF? So we tried to sit at the bar and they told us we couldn't put two tables together. Horrible.

Terrible service. Hostess answered her cell phone instead of asking us of we wanted a table. When she finally acknowledged us she asked us if we could wait 15 minutes to be seated. Mind you the restaurant is empty. We ask if she can put tables together for our party of 5 and she said that they don't do that. Terrible.
The To-Go lunch was on time, hot, and tasty. Unfortunately they don't have spoons for the soup.

By far the worst service. 15 minute wait to even be acknowkedged. Order was screwed up by server and not even any discount or anything offered from what was a horrid time from the beginning. Not a good experience at all.

This Chili's atmosphere is great, the staff is awesome! Out of all the Chili's I've been to, this is my favorite!  Things to consider: 1. The food's temperature is always on point; except for those times when the chips look kinda old (you can always send them back) 2. The 2x1 drinks are pretty strong (which is great!!!) 3. The staff is always trying to help you out with any coupons and all 4. Sometimes they don't bring water to the table, but they never stop bringing drinks once you first order them! Overall, a great Chili's to go to!

This is my favorite chilies to go to, every time I go I always get seated quickly, never do I wait more than 5 mins. Yes they did have a rodent issue, it was closed down for a short time but at least now it's safe "I'm hoping". The food is delicious, my only issue is the employees, they do take forever to get your order, the whole time I was there which was about 1 hour and a half I was only asked once if everything was ok, I was charged for the molten lava cake which I did order but never got, I was waiting to see if the waitress would actually remember but didn't, I had to ask for it. Hopefully next time I can rate something better
They didn't have any kids menus. The food was bland. Our waitress was very nice and quick. But I wouldn't come back here.

It was pretty much the basic Chili's experience. The food was good, The service was alright and it took 15 minutes to get a table. The only thing that stood out was the little tablet at the table that let you browse a few menu items, Play games and pay your bill. Being able to pay the bill and just walk out rather than waiting for a waitress was actually an improvement and I wish more places would do this. Nothing more annoying than a waitress that walks away with your card for 5 minutes when you're ready to leave now.

I  did not  enjoy  my  experience at  chilis.    The  waitress  told  me  they  were  out  of  guacamole.  I  thought  it  was  a joke.   That's  about  as  bad  as  a  pizza  place  not  having  cheese.   I  would've  left  but  I  was  in  a  party  of three  so  I  didn't  want  to  appear  difficult  when  I  called  the  1-800    I would have  been  happy  to  provide  the  check  number but we  were  unable  to  work  that  stupid  self-check  out  so  I  paid  for 2  people in  cash  to  the  third person. Started  to  make a compliant  to their  CS and   was  on  hold  for  20  minutes.   They  refused  to  offer  any  compensation If  you  want  complimentary  chips  and  salsa  you  must  sit  at  the  bar.   I was  not  happy  with  that,  either.  CHEAP  COMPANY!!!
Great food...HORRIBLE SERVICE! I can't help but love Chilis food and drinks but I wish the customer service was better

This Chili's is not as bad as the Coconut Grove location but this Doral location fucking sucks waited an hour for a table every Chili's is packed everyday mostly the Kendall and Doral location.Our waitress never came to check for ant refills instead I hat to go to the bar to beg and the girl gave me an attitude and also my food was completely bland don't go to this location
Worst chips and salsa I ever had grease all over asked the waitress to exchange them and brought back the same with more chips on top.
The food is always great! Bacon Avocado Chicken sandwich is what gets my taste buds going! If the service were better, they would get the 5th star.

Came today for lunch and had a great time. I don't like the noise but the food and service makes up for it. When my entree got to me it was cold but my boyfriends wasn't so I asked to have it heated up and without a problem they brought me a brand new one. Great place honestly and great people.

Ordered a guacamole burger that came with no guacamole, wasn't made aware that they had run out of avocados until after my food came out.  My drink order didn't make it until 15 minutes AFTER my food came out.  My waiter had no personality and tried to convince me that I should eat my burger medium rare. Terrible experience

The loaded nachos are fantastic and great for sharing. I've always been satisfied with the food and they have great variety and decent prices. Occasionally the service can feel a little slow, and even after finishing your food it can take a long time to receive the check.

Service was good, everything else was subpar at best. Food is bland and boring, drinks are watery. Don't go here expecting anything memorable. It's like eating paper, it'll fill you, but it's still paper.

We had visited this place before and although it was a disappointing experience, we decided to give them a 2nd change. Well, this will be the last time and we recommend you take your hard earned money someplace else. We ordered the guacamole and although my finger was pointing on the menu to the guacamole we wanted, the server brought us the wrong thing. We decided to keep it anyway. The appetizer had a side of guacamole and salsa with chips. The guacamole had chunks of guacamole, one so big that it took literally 2/3 of the cup. I called the server (Marino) to complaint about the dish. He stated that I didn't specified which guacamole I wanted, seriously??? So you are telling me there are two kinds of guacamole being offered and you took it upon yourself to order whatever seemed appropriate without asking me to clarify which one I really wanted, disregarding the fact that my finger clearly was pointing at the guacamole dish advertised as being prepared by the table and serve on a big dish?? Anyway, he called the Manager who comp the appetizer since we didn't even touch it. I ordered a draft beer (blue moon). Again, the server didn't even mention there was a happy hour, so he brought two glasses without asking if I wanted both at the same time. Therefore after drinking the first glass, the 2nd one was already warm. We also ordered chicken wings and Cajun chicken pasta. Again, nothing especial on either dish. In a nutshell, stay away from this place. They have problems starting at the top. One last point; NFL playoffs were playing on T.V., however only the bar area have T.V.s. The main seating areas around the bar don't have T.V.s. I was told they are working on it. Stay away!
Chilis....2 4 1 all day everyday luuuuv it great servi e great atmosphere....close to mt home....
The bartender really sucks. He is slow to ask his guest if the need anything else.  The shaker my margarita came in leaked my drink out. Can you say alcohol abuse!!!!!!!!! Where's the jail.

Visited restaurant at around 2pm, it wasn't that busy. I was seated immediately by the hostess. It took about 10min for our server to approach our table. Food was good but service could've been better as our server was not attentive. Average overall experience.
good spot to get a drink or 3. gets packed often but if you slide in the bar area you're gucci. great, for a chilis..

Service was outstanding, and they have now implemented an automated system where you can pay for your check directly from your table. No more chasing the servers and waiting for the check to come. Hope the entire restaurant industry applies this system. For a fast tasty meal, go to this Chili's. The restaurant's temperature is somewhere in the mid 60 degrees, however, so bring a light sweater. It is cold!

Every time i go there the servers aren't attentive. They are horrible at answering the phones, i called and was left on hold for 10 minutes. I called back for the next 20 minutes and still not pick up. Finally they answered in which i asked to speak to a manager and was hung up on!!!!!!

Chilies has done a Fantastic job with the revamping of the entire chain. Place is spiffed up, menu has a lot of variety and the food is GREAT!! Very reasonably priced and to add to that they also have the electronic reorder and pay option! How cool is that?!  Will always be a go-to place for me. I give it a rating of 3.6! Keep it up chilies!
Decent food but nothing to be so hyped about. Good for family and friends and great drinks. It's not the business fault but truly ruin my day to have a small group being very rowdy.
Waiters are nice enough but the quality of the meats is really bad... But hey. It's Chili's - what did you expect?

Not as good as the one on Kendall, next to the turnpike. The margaritas were weak and the food was tasteless. Wouldn't recommend. Go to Chevys instead, which is right around the corner from there. It's a lot better

Food was good very good value we got what we expected.... Now service was beyond poor!!!! I took 1 hours for us to have lunch, we walked in at 2:00 left at 3:02. Server took 10 minutes before he came to our table first time, then he really never checked on us, the tablets on the tables are cool but our was not working I couldn't log in to the rewards program nor order dessert, I did not do the survey since the tablet was not working. Again food is very good and good value, service AWEFUL !!! Btw they are under construction so there is no baby tables in the restrooms so do not bring your baby until they get done.

I am very very disappointed in what I received in this Chili's.  I love Chili's. It's my go to place for a casual night out with friends, a nice place to eat. I usually go to the one by Dadeland Mall but I decided to try something new. How unfortunate.  I ordered carry out: Two orders of Honey Chipotle Crispers with southwestern mac & cheese and fully loaded mashed potatoes. I was running a bit late because of rush hour traffic, so I called to make sure my food was still there. It took them 10 minutes to be able to tell my my food was there. But hey! It's fine. I'm sure they were very busy.  I finally get there, extremely happy that I was going to eat some amazing food that I had been craving all day. I'm checking my order and I see that I was given fries. Hmm. I don't remember asking for fries. I tell the waitress that I asked for southwestern mac & cheese. So I'm late, and they STILL get my order wrong. At this point, I'm very annoyed.  I take a seat, waiting for my mac & cheese. THIRTY MINUTES later, my first order comes out. Have to wait another FIFTEEN for my second order to come out. I ordered carry out because I wanted to quickly leave. This wasn't the case here. I was extremely upset. No way I'm going back.  On the plus side, the mac & cheese was delicious.
Slowwwww  This people need to get help  Only one waiter and a manager doesn't help what a crew.  Hope they get their get act together

Everytime I go back it just keeps getting worse. The food is good, the burger is really good. The service sucks!!!  Our waiter was in charge of the whole bar, self-seating area. He did as good as he could. The bathrooms were just plain nasty. The dining room floors seemed as if the were mopped with oil in stead of soap. I have been a regular at this 87th Ave location since 1998 and I can honestly say this is the worst I have ever seen this place. They just remodeled, and it is hip and new but something happened with the service. Please bring the old Chilies back.

Waiting some time to be greeted by my server but when I did she was pretty nice. I had the loaded fries which where delish!my boyfriend had the bacon burger which he also thought was good, and I had the sirloin which was pretty great too it came with mash potatoes and broccoli!  I HIGHLY recommend the 2 for $20 deals it's what we did and it's amazing includes one appetizer and two meals !! Although my server wasn't bad, a server named Raymond who wasn't even my server made my experience a lot better... He ran my food, brought me my refill, my bbq sauce, my to go container, & my check! He basically did everything for us !! AND he was extremely nice !!! GOING OUT OF HIS WAY For a table that isn't even his definitely deserves acknowledgement... Raymond was the best !!  ** last time I came to this chillies I received Horrible food AND service** glad I gave it a second shot

Went in, rude hostess told me to wait 15 to 30 minutes although 40% empty. Asked why the wait and was tthey dont have enough servers. Walked ourside across the street to Hooters where they had plenty of servers with better attitude.

I mean it's not terrible but everyone comes here and it gets really crowded so there's really not enough staff to really give you that 100% service. And what can you expect. It's a Chilis. They're not gonna lose business because of that. People are gonna keep coming back. Drinks are a ripoff here. Just don't get them. 2 for 1 is a lie lol the foods ok I guess. But I would just rather go down here else for Mexican food.
It's chilis ... Lunch specials are good and fills you up! Will be back in a month or so :). Had the mexi tacos and they are really good!

Great customer service. When we came, front desk girl was really welcome us and set up the best seat where we can look out side to relax while eating. Then the waitress came to take the order. She was so fast and polite. We got our salad and fajita only 10 minutes. Wooo, never fast like this in some other Restaurants. We really enjoyed our food after a busy working  day. We really recommended this chilis to you

Well this will be my 3rd time coming to this chilis and enjoying good service. I have came twice for lunch and once for dinner. Yet to experience bad service or waits. This location is super busy but efficient and always moving. Their food comes out pretty quick and hot which obviously is important to anyone. I finally tried the Smoked Carnitas burrito and it was pretty good. I really enjoyed their spinach cheese dip with chips and salsa. That stuff was fire!  Overall its a nice spot to hangout and grab some grub with friends or family. Phone service kinda sucks depending where you sit and there is no wifi. If you sit by the bar you get free chips and salsa!!

Is it possible to not leave any stars? Sat at 5:15PM. At 5:20pm they moved us to another table with the same exact set up. At 5:30 still nobody had come to help us. I asked the manager who happened to pass by if we had a server at all. He said yes, 5 minutes later a girl comes and asks if she can get us drinks I tell her we are ready to order (we had plenty of time!) she says ok and we start in the middle of our ordering she's looking the other way and says one second and walks away!! We waited another 5 minutes and no luck she never came back. We got up and left. Maybe chilli's doesn't need our money...we like the food from experience in other chilli's but safe to say we will never be back to this one...stick to Hooters and Flannigans on 87th!

Second time coming to this chilis and I can say my experience at this one is consistent-- and I mean that negatively. The food was way below par. I'm not a picky person and I don't review much, but the fact that the food at this establishment has always been hitting a sour note has lead me to constructive criticism to say the least. First visit was an undercooked slimy chicken. The second visit was drink cocktails that were half done, chicken that was (still) unbearable, fries that even I an avid fry eater could not continue to eat. The waiter seemed flustered, although he said he was new. He seemed more concerned about punching in and punching out then the experience. All in all, I'm going to TGI Fridays at Dolphin Mall from now on.

The worst restaurant that I have ever been to. We waited for more than 20 minutes and no one come to serve us!!! When we stood up to leave the waitress came and said in non polite way I'll bring the waters, but we leave. We can't pay penny for disrespecting!!!! Chill's should train their employees to respect their customers !!!!

I have been to other chilis, and I think honestly they're consistently the same everywhere: hit or miss. They were busy when we went on a Monday night when the heat were playing. They had run out of soda (Sprite and Coke) so we couldn't have long islands, just blue ones.  Our waiter was nice though, the food was good for it being chilis (my opinion on their food is always the same, just ok) and overall it was good.

The greeter was really friendly.  Great environment, although a bit loud sometimes.  The waiter that took care of us was very attentive.  And the food was just fine! My only grievance was the parking - too small for such busy place.

Food took forever and was cold.  We sent it back and they still got it wrong.  They obviously have horrible cooks.  However, the manager and waiter were very helpful and nice.  They should get new cooks!

Chilis is usually one of our go to restaurants. We tend to always be a bring group of friends and the prices always seem right. As a party of 15 we always understand that the wait time will be a bit longer than most. We visit this chilis on 3/20/16 and since the moment we walked in the Host Angie was very blunt and unwelcoming. She told us the wait was 2 hours, we still wrote down our name and called the hooters right next door they gave us a wait time of 30 mins. We were contemplating since Chilis is always our first choice. As we waited the girls decided to use the restroom and we bumped into another host, Jaz. She told us she didn't think the time frame was correct, and that we were probably be in within 40 mins to an hour tops! Within 20 mins we got our table! Big kudos to Jaz she's deserves ALL the credit for having great customer service!!! She deserves all these five stars.

The worst services ever in this Chili's, not guacamole, not avocado, not merlot, not lemonade. The good came first and then the appetizers we wait a lot. My favorite salad was really bad. The waitress tried to be nice but almost everything was horrible.

The service was not great at all. We arrived and we're sat by the hostess. Waited waited 30 minutes to get greeted by the server and when we ask for their server who was our server all of them replied all he should be coming soon and nobody gave us any attention at all. Finally 45 minutes later we finally meet the server and the drinks took another 25 minutes where the appetizer arrived before the drinks. The right when the food arrived there were no utensils on the table and we had to wait another 10 minutes to see our server so we can get our utensils to be able to eat our meal. One of the guys I was sitting down when he went to move his chair forward almost slipped and fell on the floor because the floor was slippery and dirty it was very unhygienic. I think the service in this chili was not that great at all and I mean not returned because of his horrible service.

Wow. I regularly do not come to these places because I feel like this is what u pay for. I don't think I'll be coming back. Where is the manager here? The floor was slippery and dirty. The food was greasy. I barely touched it. Only good food was the dessert. Our server took 30 mins to attend us. He was very nice but the place was way to busy for only 2 servers. He disappeared after we received our food and left us no utensils. My friend ended up getting up to bother the bar for the material.  There was a spill next to us and no clean up crew came to clean it up. I cannot get over how bad the food was and the service was poor:-/

Worst chilis ever...had to wait longer than expected than waited over an hour for my food to be served only cuz my husband said something but they forgot...waiter was ok he forgot my refill and messed up my food but i ate it cuz i was starving...my one yr old was uncontrollable of how long we waited...only great employee was a young girl sitting us down she was very happy and friendly.

Never come to this Chillies !!!!!! today is my dad 60 year birthday and our host was completely disrespectful and rude arguing with my father. She gave 2 tables away and blamed us for not listening when she called out our name when we were In front of her the whole time and never did she once ask us but instead attack us for her bad customer service. Horrible horrible horrible !!

I give this chillis an average rating because it can go smoothly or just plain bad. The food is pretty tasty, so can't complain there. However, sometimes the staff can be rude. It depends on who you get as your server, but sometimes they're just not having it. They can take long at times as well, but I'm guessing sometimes they're overcrowded and understaffed. Their biggest hits are the margaritas, the 2 for 1 drinks and of course their molten. They're 2 for $20 also gives people a chance to have a quick meal for a moderate price.

All time favorite restaurant.. Unfortunately, this location doesn't cut it. The timing of service is too slow. Drinks, appetizers, refills, etc. Waitress wrote down the order and still managed to bring the incorrect side orders to one of us. Once corrected, she was confused and didn't understand that the order was wrong. She also forgot my side order of ranch and my partners beer. Then, when the correct side order arrived, it was freezing cold Mac and cheese which we had to return. Finally, we ordered 2 Chocolate Molten cakes which barely had chocolate syrup on top (picture attached). Not the best quality and service.

This is a difficult review to write. I have come to this Chili's several times, and almost every time the overall experience is very different. I believe the problem is that they are almost always very crowded, working beyond capacity, which puts a lot of pressure on the serving and cooking staff. Service quality depends a lot on the person that will serve you. I have had great service, and I have had awful service (to the point of almost standing up and walking out without paying my bill, and screw it all, in anger). The overwhelming crowds create parking problems (most people park at Walmart and walk over), cleanliness problems (yes, the place does not feel clean, as a restaurant should always), frequent errors on orders (ours was wrong last night), staff that is missing in action, and the place is extremely loud, making it hard to even have a normal conversation with your table mates (wait till the kids start screaming, then it feels like a nut house). But ok, got the bad off my chest, here's the good: - Prices are good, and they have specials like 2 entrees for $20, including fajitas, great deal. - Drinks are always 2-for-1, order a beer get two mugs, nice ($3.79 Bud Light, 2 mugs) - The place is fun, if you are younger than me - Most staff members do they best to control chaos, and I feel for them. Kudos to those that keep their cool and try their best to serve well. - Food quality and taste is above average, I never had a dish I didn't like. So, here you have it: if you are ready for a hectic and noisy experience, with good food and decent prices, and can be forgiving if things don't go exactly as you wished, this Chili's the ticket. But if you want quiet and great service, with excellent dishes but a bit more expensive, go to Tony Roma's up 87th ave close to 33rd street, it is the ideal alternative. Cheers!

Great service - no wait. From the moment we walked in we were told that it was going to be a 10 minute wait time,and we didn't even wait a minute ,and they called us up. Our waiter was super friendly ,and he is awesome in helping you pick out your entree if your undecided and he gave us great recommendations drinks!

This is my second visit to this location and sadly nothing had changed. The food was brought out in a semi warm temperature. I always order the fajita trio, which I have to say, it not worth having if it doesn't come out sizzling. Our tortillas were brought out with no cover. Within minutes they were hard and dry. Our usual appetizer of the skillet Queso was watery and it barely had any meat. The nachos for the Queso were clumped up, greasy and stale. Both visits merit the same complaints. The only reason the location gets an extra staff is because of out waitress. She was on the ball, friendly and outgoing. We only saw her a couple of times being that she was running around but she made those minutes exceptional. Not too sure if I can waste anymore money at this location again. We are very disappointed with this spot.

I went there last night to eat after house of horror. Or waitress was really sweet and attentive. If I'd ever go back it would be because of her honestly. I waited way too long for my food, over an hour. The manager came and apologized and fixed an order that was wrong which was thoughtful. When the food came, it was okay, not really a big deal. I'm not crazy about chain restaurants because I feel that they don't pay attention to the quality of service but our waitress was great it was just the kitchen that was way too slow, I'm assuming. If I'd go back it would be for happy hour. Not necessarily to sit down and eat.

Came for work lunch, few of  my co-workers got RAW burgers.   Service took way to long.  Wasn't the waitress fault, process needs serious improvement.  Not sure I would come to this location  anytime soon.  Disappointed, other people who came after us and had quicker service.

At at chilis today. Typical chilis quality which is pretty good and gets the job done.  What made the experience was the service. Our server was Tatiana (I think that's how to spell her name). Awesome server, friendly and attentive. We never had to ask her for refills....she would always be checking her tables and when she noticed a table was running low she would quickly make sure we got new drinks. Chilis you guys better keep her...can't find servers like that everywhere.

Terrible service, food took forever and when it got there, my quesadillas looked so fried, that it could've been a pita chip instead of a quesadilla. Didn't even bother to return it since it took almost an hour to arrive anyway.

I've been to this location on various occasions with my friends and it's been ok. We come for the food but the service is terrible. I came today with my boyfriend to eat. We walked in and waited to be seated for about 2 minutes as the host was no where to be seen, servers walked by but no one acknowledged us. Then the host come and we tell her table for 2. She tells us we can sit by the bar area and my boyfriend asks if we can get a booth by the outer side of the restaurant. She tells us that it's slower service so we kind of looked at each other and decided to sit at the bar area and she just pointed to the booth. The table was extremely sticky and wet, the menus were dirty. I tried to put those issues aside because I really wanted to eat there. My boyfriend was upset by the issue and we sat there for 10 minutes without being attended or looked at. We decided to leave and as we were walking out the host didn't even stop us to ask what was wrong due to the fact that she was too focused on her phone. This is probably going to be my last time at this location. I really hope they fix the service  issues, and this is coming from a previous host myself to the server that I am now.

This was by far the worst chilis I have been to regarding not only service but food quality. Our waitress, Jessica, was extremely inattentive and careless. We waited about 15 minutes to even be greeted, when there are only two other tables she was serving. My chips came out cold and once the food was delivered she did not check on us once to refill our drinks or the chips. We had to ask another waitress to call her over to get more drinks and our checks. Very dissatisfied. She was also standing watching TV while we waited for our refills.

This place is pretty bad for dinner. Came here last night and the waitress we had was pretty bad. She assisted us with what we needed which was good. But the table that was across from where I was sitting at was her group of friends. She gave her friends basically VIP treatment. My table would order drinks and it would take like 10-15 minutes for us to receive them. But her friends would get their drinks in 5 minutes. She would also sit down and talk to her friends and there would be times where she would take sips out of her friends alcoholic drinks. I'm sorry but working in the restaurant business drinking on the job even just a little is unprofessional. Also my girlfriend ordered a Bloody Mary to try it out and she didn't like it. She asked the waitress if we can possibly exchange it for something else and she said she wasn't gonna charge us for them but she did. Wouldn't come back here again. Go to the dade land location they will actually take care of you.
Terrible experience, fajitas not good at all  The only good thing was the 2for1 beer  But it you want to eat don't come to chili's you end up with an upset stomach  Restrooms are filthy dirty

The food was yummy and our waitress Yeisel was very nice and attentive. She was very professional and brought us water even though we didn't ask for it which is something that we appreciated since many waiters and waitresses forget that simple touch. the only reason I am only giving four stars is because the service was wonderful but the food took extremely long to come out from the kitchen our waitress even asked the manager to come to our table to apologize, we never complained about the delay but it was nice that they came to just advise us that things were taking long in the kitchen while we were waiting for our food several tables around us didn't even wait to get their order they just got up and left. As I mentioned the service and food were good but we really waited almost 1 hour and 10 minutes for our food

This Chilies is really a very BUSY place...Tuesday night, 9:30 pm, non holiday...the place is packed.  Food was good...ordered the 2 for $20 ( now two for $22).  Had fajitas, and half rack of baby back ribs...fajita's were the normal great...the ribs however were a little dry!  What made this place great was our server!  He made the experience wonderful...always attentive, making our dining experience great.  His name was Josh "the Jew".  Seriously!

Came to this chilis with my dad and there was no Host . Several people were waiting at once for a while and still no host . Had to track down a guy myself whose name was Dave "manager in training" he was extremely rude and had a careless attitude. Will not be returning here as there is no good customer service
The take out is horrendous. I placed an order online. Was told it would take 26 min. Arrived 30 min after I ordered. And still had to wait. Had to wait at the restaurant an additional 30 min.
It was not that great.  They did not provide enough napkins.  They forgot to bring out a drink.  They did not provide extra small plates for the sharing of the appetisers.  The food was good though.
Quick and yummy food, they have a large menu and lots of choices to pick from. The desserts are great & the 2 for 1 drinks never disappoint

This is the worst restaurant i have ever been to. My wife wanted to come here because for some unknown reason she seems to enjoy these chain restaurants which are all awful. Any who, lets just say it started out wrong from the moment we walked in when the hostess was the most unenthusiastic person i have ever met, if you hate your job that bad then just quit. When my wife, our daughter, and i were finally sat the waitress took our order but was impatient with us to the point that she walked away without letting my wife decide which sides she wanted and what food we were ordering for our daughter. Our food came out but not our daughter's, my wife had to request it again. Isn't it restaurant policy for the kids food to come out first? She then had to request for her apple juice which they also forgot. Back to my food, the ribs were cold so i had to tell a waitress that passed by which called a manager and he quickly swapped it out for a "fresh" half rack. The ribs were room temperature so clearly they're just sitting in the kitchen under a light since they came back within a minute. Another problem with the ribs were that i asked for them to be dry rub and they came out with barbecue sauce, i didnt complain about that. Then the waitress gave us a refill of our iced tea without ice so the tea was hot. Clearly this waitress needs to be retrained because wow this was the worst service i have ever received. I dont remember her name if she even said it. All i remember was that she was a black girl and we were on table 22. I actually tried calling the store twice to ask for her name but the people that answered didnt want to give me her name and hung up on me when they were going to "put me on hold and ask" I will never ever go to another chilis simply because of this experience.

Hey again, ok this is my second time here and since my last visit this reataurant has had major upgrading. Recommendation 2.30 pm is the perfect time on a Sunday to go, music is not loud, not too much people faster service excellent!!!! I asked for the $22 dinner for 2 excellent too so much variety I asked for the Half baby back ribs they came with french fries and my husband asked for the chicken quesadillas big portions! And the best part you don't have to wait for the check you can just pay it in the machine, look for the pictures amd video I uploaded

I've been a fan of chilis for years. However, today the service my family and I received was absolutely terrible. Our waitress was nice but our food took over an hour to come out. Other tables, including some that came after us, got their food and left before we got served. At first thy brought only two of the three meals. The third meal took another 30-40 minutes and by then wasn't even wanted. The manager had no proper customer service communication skills and although he comped PART of the bill, he wasn't sympathetic whatsoever. If you ask me, everything should've been free. Next time I'll go to the chilis on 88th.
The environment was overcrowded and very loud. Drinks are watery and seems like they skimp on the alcohol during happy hour to force you to buy more.

Usually I love Chilis. I used the app to wait in line, Uber's here and when we arrived we got seated right away. However the food took long, when it finally arrived it was cold and it was sloppy. I ordered the triple dipper appetizer as an entre with the south western egg rolls, the cheddar bites, and the honey-chipotle crispers. When it arrived the dipping sauces were spilled all over the food and mixed in together. We also got the new smoke house combo that looked delicious on the menu. It came with house smoked BBQ ribs, hand battered chicken crispers, roasted sweet corn, home style fries, chili-garlic toast, and garlic dill pickles. When it arrived the corn was plain and 1/2 the size (unlike the picture and description), the ribs barely had any meat on it. Bones with BBQ sauce. Honestly it seemed like the kitchen people really didn't care what product they were putting out. The bar was worse, we ordered blue long islands, and it tasted like cleaning products. Honestly horrible. I usually don't like sending things back, but the drink was truly unbearable. We stuck with the regular long islands, which wasn't too much better. Our waitress was great though, she honestly had nothing to do with the bad experience we had. I would rather drive further and go to a better chilis than come back here; 10 mins away from me.
Chilli  is one of my favorite restaurants ever!  The server was wonderful and prompted with our food. And our glasses were never empty. I love to go to this place in Doral it's the best.

Let me start of by saying that I been a customer of the company for YEARS! Tonight was the WORST experience ever! Unfortunately I had to put 1 star if not would be negative infinity stars. Let me walk you through the night.  We walked in, the host sat us in a closed area, which we found out and had to move. I did not mind since it was extremely cold and the new table was perfect on temperature. Out waiter I believe her name Yeisel Do (name on receipt) came took out order. It's four of us, we order a burger for my brother, my grandma ordered sirloin WELL WELL DONE -NO SPICY-my mom had the fajitas trio -NO SPICY- she also asked to substitute the rice & beans for mash & broccoli since for dietary purposes she can't have the spices mainly in the rice, she said she would ask her manager, I also had the fajitas trio -NO PEPPERS- yes to SPICY. Long story short, food came my brothers was perfect. Grandmothers stake was NOT WELL DONE. Mines HAD PEPPERS, no spicy. My moms NO PEPPERS AND SPICY. I had to ask a DIFFERENT waiter to take my grandmothers steak back because ours was NO WHERE TO BE FOUND. As far as my plate & my moms I personally was just over it at that point, we did not realized we had each other's plate until later on, my mom did not felt the SPICY until about half way into the plate, was building up at which point she needed water, I made a signal to our server, to which she acknowledged me but never came by instead went to the table next to us to get payment, I was done, I stood up went to her and asked her for water for my mom, she says yes I'll be right over, as I am sitting down and we are waiting for water my mom told me where is she? And looks back only to see OUR SERVER having a FULL ON CONVERSATION & LAUGHING with other servers at that point I stood up went to the bar and told a girl that i just wanted water at that point we are just leaving and never coming back, I told her about the food and how they are allergic to spice she asked what table I was on, showed her and went back to it, she then brought 3 cups of water.  I paid and we left.  I do have to say that girl, I wished I had gotten her name, the one that took us the water, was the only right person there, at least that attended us other than the GUY (not our server) that took my grandmothers steak back. Only those 2 were good. It's really a shame! I never had a problem like this or even close at any chilis. They just lost me and anyone remotely close to me as a customer.  Just HORRIBLE SERVICE, from the extra charging for the food, (which I gotten substituted before, today they didn't want to it, because they didn't, but I know could be done) to the unprofessional treatment by the server, confusing all the foods and sides, to the lack of attention for simple WATER!  I only hope my mother is okay, and that simple mistake from their end doesn't harm her because it that turns out to be the case, that would be a different ball game, for Chili's.
They have the best fajitas ever ! And of course nothing's is better then the molten to finish off your cravings.

I visited this place a couple of times. It is a good place to enjoy the food. The chips with the Mexican salsa is so good. I also ordered the crispy chicken waffles and there is a combination between sweet and salty, it is just delicious. And also I tried the fajitas with shrimp and steak. All that for only 33$, it was not expensive at all. Great service too. I'll go again for sure.

T and Richard are great bartenders and make my dining experience awesome. Mike is great in the kitchen and always makes sure my order is perfect! Definitely will be back for those tasty margaritas and triple dippers and cookie skillet dessert!

I have been to Chili's plenty of times.  This experience though has been the worst one I've ever had at a Chili's.  We had to ask who our server was after waiting to be greeted for 15 mins (after already being seated). They took our order, and we waited another 20 mins for our food.  By the time our food did get there, it was our main course with the appetizer.  I mentioned the appetizer, they took the main course back and finally brought out the app 10 minutes later.  You could tell it was just sitting there - not sure if someone forgot to bring it out or what but we ordered the white queso dip and the guac on top was brown, the pico de gallo was dried out and the cheese itself was almost hard rather than saucy from being under the warmer for so long.  The then brought out our meals.  You can tell this was all also sitting under the warmer while we finished the app.  My pasta was dry despite asking for extra sauce and they didnt garnish the pasta with any cheese like other locations do.  My father's burger was soggy and the pickles inside the burger were hot and soggy instead of crisp -- again, this is from sitting under the warmer. I asked for a coke, but they completely forgot.  I would usually go for dessert, but I just wanted to leave this place so I didn't order any.   I've been here other times and it was never this bad, but this experience has made me not want to return.

I was a lover of chillis! Never again!!!! Food was ok but doesn't compare to their old menu. The service was horrible!!!!! Our waitress apparently had her sister and friends in the table behind us and ignored us. Appetizer came after our food. We had to chase her down for napkins and refills. Once the food was taken away we weren't asked if needed anything like dessert. Not to mention we didn't have that little kiosk at our table. We sat there for a some time while she socialized. My husband had to go ask her for the check and her lame ass excuse... she's training somebody and is bombarded (not hectic enough to socialize though) never again!!!!! Our main thing was get a molten and we left without that. Chili's isn't what it was!

Love chili's!!! Food is great, service is great, wait time is not too bad, however my favorite drink of all time is the frozen mango margarita and the machine that makes the frozen margaritas is broken!  I visit this location quite often with friends and family since it's close to home and the machine had been broken for months!!! The bartenders have even recommended that I contact corporate since they also feel it's been a long time since the machine has supposedly "shipped". It's so sad and it's the only reason why I didn't rate this restaurant 5 stars.
I used to love this place. Not anymore it's loud the food was ok the waiter forgot my food. Service was just so bad I wish I could give it less than one star.
Chillis has the 2 for 1 happy hour. Quick service and good for a drink after work! Highly recommend the bar area. Alex was my server he took wonderful care of us. GET HIM A RAISE!!!
